2013.title: Power Up Portland
2013.headline: work
2013.client: Oregon Museum of Sciecne and Industry (OMSI)

images.caption: Multiple users interact as they try to find a balance in energy consumtion
Periodically the an old rotary telephone rings and alerts visitors that conditions have changed and new challenges in energy consumption have started
Users press the large physical buttons to control the energy sources

2013.description: Interactive exhibit allowing visitors to control an animated power plant with physical controls

2015.title: Digital Organ Explorers
2015.headline: work
2015.description: An augmented reality application for the iPad that enables users to view content overlays against real physical models of four different human organs.

images.caption: The brain explorer with augmented overlays as seen by a visitor through the iPad
Each iPad is encased in a steel housing that rotates around the organ model. As the arm rotates hotspots overlays highlight important parts of each organ

2015.title: Partnership Hub
2015.headline: work
2015.description: A thirty foot LED wall presentation platform providing executives at Telstra the ability to demonstrate the reach of Telstra across multiple industries

images.caption: Attract mode displays flocking particles against roving shapes and images
Particles swarming to form phrases
Partners are displayed in dynamically arranged and sized layouts
Behind the scenes look at physics enabled particles and shapes

2015.technologies: C++, Cinder, MQTT, Microsof Kinect, Box2D

images.caption: The new visitors center in Greenville serves to attract prospective students
Life-size figures invite visitors to interact
Using a Kinect, the application recognizes a visitor's presence and prompts them to interact
Visitors navigate through the entire experience using a single swipe gesture

2012.title: Harmony Table
2012.headline: work
2012.description: Multi-touch table allowing visitors to explore music theory through abstract visualizations and interactive instruments

images.caption: Attract mode plays familiar melodies and animates their notes
Users control radial pianos using felt pucks
Corresponding notes are called out across painos
The multi-touch capabilities support as many users as can fit around the table
Colors shift as notes are transposed from key to key

2014.title: Human Rights Now
2014.headline: work
2014.description: Thirty foot data visualization wall providing a concise view of human rights issues around the world today.

images.caption: The Canadian Museum for Human Rights is an amazing architectural monument
Human Rights Now is a nine meter wide data visualization media wall
The wall displays dynamic info-graphics with programmatic animation and effects
